intro: Halecus verus, commonly known as the common halecus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Halecus verus is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. It plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
